azure-dev.auth.useIntegratedAuth.descrip: Use the VS Code integrated authentication with the Azure Developer CLI, instead of its own authentication. Note: This feature is currently in alpha and active under development, and requires a version of the Azure Development CLI that supports it.

azure-dev.walkthroughs.start.title: Deploy your App with the Azure Developer CLI
azure-dev.walkthroughs.start.description: Your quick guide to set up, provision, and deploy a new app with the azd CLI.
azure-dev.walkthroughs.start.steps.insta:
Install the Azure Developer CLI (**azd**) to get started with Azure development.
[Install](command:azure-dev.commands.cli.install)
azure-dev.walkthroughs.start.steps.login: Sign In to your Azure Account

Sign in or create an Azure account to successfully run **azd** commands.
[Sign In](command:azure-dev.commands.cli.login)
Tip: Clicking the **Sign In** button may open a new browser window with a prompt to input your Azure credentials.
azure-dev.walkthroughs.start.steps.scaff:
View the [Awesome azd template gallery](https://azure.github.io/awesome-azd/) to find a template with the infrastructure that's right for your app, or select a template directly from the Command Palette (``azd init``).
[Select a template and initialize your project](command:azure-dev.commands.cli.init)
Tip: To use a template from the Awesome azd site, copy its GitHub repo URL and enter it when prompted during ``azd init``.
azure-dev.walkthroughs.start.steps.up.ti: Get your App Up and Running in Azure
azure-dev.walkthroughs.start.steps.up.de:
Provision and deploy your app to Azure (``azd up``) by right-clicking your azure.yaml file and selecting **up** from the context menu (pictured), by clicking the button below.
[One-click provision + deploy](command:azure-dev.commands.cli.up)
Tip: You can also run the ``azd up`` command in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.quickOpen?%5B%22%3E%20Azure%20Developer%20CLI%20%28azd%29%3A%20up%22%5D) or your terminal to provision and deploy your app.
azure-dev.walkthroughs.start.steps.explo:
- View all available azd commands by searching "Azure Developer" in the [Command Palette](command:workbench.action.quickOpen?%5B%22%3E%20Azure%20Developer%20CLI%20%28azd%29%3A%20%22%5D).
- Check out our [blog](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/azure-sdk/introducing-the-azure-developer-cli-a-faster-way-to-build-apps-for-the-cloud/), [release notes](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev/releases), or [GitHub](https://github.com/Azure/azure-dev) to learn more about our newest features and to contribute to the development of our tool!
- Explore the latest azd-compatible templates at [Awesome azd](https://azure.github.io/awesome-azd/).
